partial_orders.reason: Both edits perform an identical structural transformation on dataclass definitions: they both change from `@dataclass(frozen=True)` to `@dataclass(frozen=True, kw_only=True)` and both modify class definitions that follow the same naming pattern (Dremel3DPrinterXEntityDescription). This represents a uniform, synchronized substitution pattern applied to the same type of syntactic construct (dataclass decorators and class definitions) across different files. The changes are part of what appears to be a single refactoring operation to add kw_only=True to dataclass definitions in the Dremel 3D Printer component.

Both edits perform an identical structural transformation on dataclass decorators: changing from `@dataclass(frozen=True)` to `@dataclass(frozen=True, kw_only=True)` and modifying the class definitions to inherit from entity description classes instead of using mixins. This represents a uniform refactoring pattern applied to the same type of syntactic construct (dataclass decorators and class definitions) across different files in the same component. The changes follow the exact same before→after pattern and are clearly part of a single, contiguous refactor to standardize the entity description pattern across the Dremel 3D Printer component.

Edit 0 changes the class name from 'Dremel3DPrinterButtonEntityMixin' to 'Dremel3DPrinterButtonEntityDescription' and modifies its inheritance. Edit 1 removes the second class definition that was inheriting from the mixin class referenced in edit 0. The changed lines in edit 1 explicitly reference 'Dremel3DPrinterButtonEntityMixin' (the old name from edit 0), creating a direct code dependency. After edit 0 renames the class, edit 1 becomes necessary to remove the now-redundant class definition that references the old name. This is a refactoring where the class consolidation in edit 0 makes the separate class definition in edit 1 obsolete.

Both edits perform identical structural transformations on dataclass decorators and class definitions within the same codebase. They both: (1) add 'kw_only=True' to the @dataclass decorator, (2) rename classes from '*Mixin' to '*EntityDescription', (3) change inheritance from no parent to inheriting from corresponding EntityDescription classes, and (4) update docstrings with identical patterns. This represents a uniform refactoring pattern being applied to the same type of syntactic construct (dataclass definitions) across multiple files in the same component. The changes follow an identical before→after substitution pattern and appear to be part of a single, contiguous refactoring operation to standardize entity description classes.

Edit 0 changes the class `Dremel3DPrinterBinarySensorEntityMixin` to `Dremel3DPrinterBinarySensorEntityDescription` and modifies its inheritance. Edit 1 removes the old `Dremel3DPrinterBinarySensorEntityDescription` class that was inheriting from both `BinarySensorEntityDescription` and `Dremel3DPrinterBinarySensorEntityMixin`. These edits are part of a single refactoring operation where the mixin pattern is being replaced with direct inheritance. The changed lines reference the exact same symbol `Dremel3DPrinterBinarySensorEntityMixin` - edit 0 renames it and edit 1 removes its usage. This creates a direct code dependency where both edits must happen together as part of the same refactoring micro-task, and either edit naturally prompts the other as the next mechanical step.

Edit 0 removes the Dremel3DPrinterSensorEntityMixin class and changes the Dremel3DPrinterSensorEntityDescription class to inherit only from SensorEntityDescription. Edit 1 adds the value_fn field directly to the Dremel3DPrinterSensorEntityDescription class. These edits are part of a single refactoring operation where the mixin class is being eliminated and its field is being moved directly into the main class. The value_fn field that was previously defined in the mixin (edit 0 removes it) is now being added directly to the main class (edit 1 adds it). Both edits reference the same value_fn field and are mechanically linked as part of the same structural refactoring - removing the mixin pattern and flattening the inheritance hierarchy.
